channel.title: Add ip in client
channel.description:
hello,
I want to import my server's ip into my client, so I don't have to typ it all the time. But I can't figure out where to put it. I use the Csk client as basis for my client from team Swat.
I've found this sentence in the client.java file:
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15;
But where do I put my ip?
Thanks

item.title: Add ip in client
item.dc:creator: @w-e_s-l_e-y w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com
item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Add ip in client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Lets me explain that line to you.

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j);
            j += 15;

Is just drawing the area on your login screen for the IP to be shown.

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + [b]server[/b] + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15;
The bolded word there, is all you need to look at. That is a string being called, and by the name of it, that looks like that string, holds your IP. Find that string in client.java, and you should solve your problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Add ip in client
item.dc:creator: @w-e_s-l_e-y w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com
item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

hello,

I want to import my server’s ip into my client, so I don’t have to typ it all the time. But I can’t figure out where to put it. I use the Csk client as basis for my client from team Swat.

I’ve found this sentence in the client.java file:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? “@xxx@|” : “”), j);
j += 15;

But where do I put my ip?

Thanks
